decisions.title: Use Tauri over Electron
decisions.context: Electron subprocess hangs after 6+ attempts. Need reliable process spawning.

alternatives.tradeoff: Subprocess hangs, 150MB+ bundle
Limited UX control, plugin not product

decisions.rationale: Smaller bundle, Rust process spawning is reliable, existing React code ports directly

decisions.title: Hybrid stack: Rust I/O + TypeScript domain logic
decisions.context: Need fast I/O (process spawning, file ops) but rapid iteration on domain logic
decisions.chosen: Rust for I/O, TypeScript for brain/state/agents
decisions.rationale: Best of both worlds â€” reliability where it matters, iteration speed where it matters

decisions.title: Port Synaptica brain engine as memory layer
decisions.context: Need cross-session project memory. Synaptica already has hippocampal retrieval.
decisions.chosen: Port 9-stage pipeline from Synaptica, adapt to project-scoped memory
decisions.rationale: Proven architecture, pain/win/fact types, plasticity/decay already battle-tested

decisions.title: JSON file storage, swappable to SQLite
decisions.context: MSVC build tools not available at scaffold time for better-sqlite3
decisions.chosen: JsonStore with same interface, migrate to SQLite when ready
decisions.rationale: Unblocks development immediately, storage is an implementation detail

decisions.title: Remove max-w-3xl width constraint from all views
decisions.context: All list views (Memory, Decisions, Questions, Sessions, Cost) had max-w-3xl on their content containers, leaving dead horizontal space on wider screens.
decisions.chosen: Remove max-w-3xl, let cards span full width

alternatives.tradeoff: Consistent reading width but wastes screen space
Looks better than left-aligned but adds complexity

decisions.rationale: Cards filling the full width looks better and uses the available space. No content benefit to constraining width in a desktop app.

decisions.title: Keep deliberations practical and actionable
decisions.context: Pat observed that meta-philosophical topics like 'is this system valuable' cause agents to spiral into unfalsifiable positions
decisions.chosen: Only run deliberations on concrete, actionable topics: feature design, code architecture, UX improvements, what to build next
decisions.rationale: The system proved its value through actual use. Abstract meta-questions waste tokens and produce no actionable output.

decisions.title: Multi-project support is now IN scope
decisions.context: Previously scoped out (Feb 22). Pat reversed this after experiencing the pain of opening Claude Code from tax-credit-calculators and having no HW tools available. The current single-project model doesn't work when Pat works across multiple projects.
decisions.chosen: Full multi-project support: project switcher, global vs project memory, auto-onboard new projects

alternatives.tradeoff: Simpler but forces Pat to only use HW from one directory

alternatives.option: Manual project switching via config edit
alternatives.tradeoff: Works but terrible UX, no auto-onboard

decisions.rationale: Pat hit the real pain: opened Claude Code from a different project and had zero HW tools. Multi-project is a requirement, not a nice-to-have.

decisions.title: Verification test decision (delete me)
decisions.context: Testing the decision recording feature during verification run.
decisions.rationale: Need to confirm the decision system works end-to-end.

decisions.title: Always write handoff before suggesting app restart
decisions.context: Pat noticed sessions losing context when Claude suggests restarting the app without saving state first
decisions.chosen: Mandatory hw_write_handoff() call before any restart suggestion, no exceptions
decisions.rationale: A restart kills the current session. Without a handoff, the next session starts blind. This rule prevents context loss.

decisions.title: Deliberation v2: one mandatory path + quick-insights
decisions.context: Self-audit of deliberation on guardrails found 5 structural failures. Deliberation panel (6 agents) converged on: one mandatory path for binding decisions, separate lightweight tool for flavor-testing.
decisions.chosen: One mandatory deliberation path (plan+coverage+conclude) with quality tags (consensus/tension/shifted). Separate hw_quick_insights for non-binding sanity checks. Balance notes optional. Auto-runner pauses at synthesis.

alternatives.tradeoff: Rejected: user must predict uncertainty before having data. Quick mode becomes a loophole to skip rigor.
Rejected: never changed mediation behavior in practice. Paperwork without signal.
Rejected: enables checkbox theater. Agents can 'address' without real engagement.

decisions.rationale: Two-tier modes create prediction burden (user must guess stakes upfront). One path removes the choice. Quick-insights is clearly separate and non-binding. Quality tags replace binary coverage to catch checkbox theater and groupthink.

decisions.title: Buddy recap: hybrid rolling buffer + AI summary on clean exit
decisions.context: Need crash-safe session recap for buddy to display on next startup. Must survive X, Alt+F4, crashes.
decisions.chosen: Hybrid: rolling buffer continuously writes last ~10 activity items (crash-safe baseline). On clean exit, detached Node subprocess upgrades the raw buffer into an AI-generated summary. Buddy displays whichever exists -- polished if available, raw if crash.

alternatives.tradeoff: Nice summaries but no crash safety -- hard exits lose everything
Crash-proof but raw activity data, not polished summaries

decisions.rationale: Rolling buffer costs nothing (same pattern as activity.json). AI summary on clean exit gives a nicer experience when possible. Crash fallback to raw buffer means we never lose context. Best of both worlds.

decisions.title: Build Cortex as standalone ACE replacement
decisions.context: Discussed adding Augment Context Engine MCP vs building our own. Pat wanted our own version tailored to our workflow.
decisions.chosen: Build Cortex: standalone MCP server at C:/Users/Patri/CascadeProjects/cortex/. Claude Haiku for file summarization, structured JSON index, keyword/concept search. No vector DB. 5 MCP tools: cortex_index, cortex_search, cortex_context, cortex_architecture, cortex_related.

alternatives.tradeoff: Immediate 70% boost claim but not tailored to our workflow, dependency on external service
Deep research but requires API key, monthly cost, not code-specific

decisions.rationale: With agents we can build something more attuned to our needs. No vector DB infra complexity. Claude API handles the semantic understanding. Per-project index in .cortex-index/ directory.

decisions.title: State storage: split files + atomic writes (B+), defer SQLite
decisions.context: state.json holds all tasks, decisions, questions, memories in one file. Concurrent write risk from MCP server, Discord listener. Deliberation with 4 agents.
decisions.chosen: Split state.json into tasks.json, decisions.json, questions.json, memories.json. Atomic writes via write-to-temp-then-rename with Windows NTFS retry loop. Backup copy before each write. Session-start hook .backup fallback. SQLite deferred to multi-project epic.

alternatives.tradeoff: 2 hours but doesn't fix truncation risk or reduce blast radius
Fixes everything but 2-3 days work, breaks file-watcher reactivity, MSVC compilation issues on Windows, premature given multi-project timeline

decisions.rationale: Backendarch shifted from SQLite to B+ after: (1) multi-project epic is unplanned so SQLite timing is premature, (2) better-sqlite3 has MSVC native compilation issues on Windows, (3) split files are forward-compatible with eventual SQLite migration. Remaining no-ACID risk explicitly accepted.

decisions.title: Defer tauri-specta until Rust type refactor
decisions.context: Researched tauri-specta v2.0.0-rc.21 for type-safe IPC. All our Rust commands use serde_json::Value, so specta would just export JsonValue types -- zero benefit. The useTauriData hook pattern (dynamic string-based dispatch) is also incompatible with specta's static named functions. Still in RC with breaking changes between versions.
decisions.chosen: Defer tauri-specta adoption until we refactor Rust commands to use proper typed structs

alternatives.tradeoff: Zero type safety benefit, adds RC dependency fragility for no gain

alternatives.option: Adopt now and refactor all commands to typed structs
alternatives.tradeoff: 2-3 day effort, high risk of breaking running app, not the current priority

decisions.rationale: Three blockers: (1) Value types everywhere means no actual type safety gain, (2) useTauriData hook pattern incompatible, (3) still RC with fragile dependency chain. When we do the Rust type refactor, adding specta at that point is nearly free.

decisions.title: Defer Agent Teams, continue using subagents
decisions.context: Researched Claude Code Agent Teams (experimental). Requires CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS=1. Split-pane mode unsupported on Windows Terminal. Known issues: orphaned sessions, task status lag, no session resumption. Community reports UI crashes with 4+ agents.
decisions.chosen: Continue using subagents (Task tool) for parallel work. Defer Agent Teams until stable release.
decisions.rationale: Subagents are production-ready and cover our needs. Agent Teams adds inter-agent messaging and shared task lists, but instability on Windows and no split-pane support make it impractical. Will re-evaluate when it exits experimental.

decisions.title: Watcher system: repurpose from per-task file copies to persistent crash-safety sentinel
decisions.context: The watcher system (hw_spawn_watcher, app_shutdown_copy type) was used for merging worktree Rust changes on app exit. Pat flagged watchers as more trouble than worth for that use case (terminal flashing, per-task overhead). Discussion revealed the real value: crash recovery. A detached process that survives app crashes can backup state, write crash markers, and enable graceful recovery.
decisions.chosen: Redesign watchers as a single persistent crash-safety sentinel spawned by buddy on startup. Hidden process (no console window), polls Tauri PID, runs recovery on crash/exit. Visual indicator on buddy shows sentinel health. Replaces dozens of per-task throwaway watchers with one always-on guardian.

alternatives.tradeoff: Lose crash recovery capability -- no process survives a Tauri crash
Terminal flashing, overhead, Pat already rejected this
Architecturally cleaner but massive effort, separate build pipeline

decisions.rationale: The sentinel survives crashes (detached process), is invisible to the user (windowsHide), and provides crash recovery that no in-process hook can offer. Buddy is the natural owner since it's the persistent visual element. For worktree Rust merges, manual file copy is simpler and more reliable.
